page.title: 11WORK OF BANKS PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: THE POPULATION OF BANKS IS ABOUT 3,000 PEOPLE.THE CHAIRMAN OF THE PARISH COUNCIL WOULD LIKE TO SEE IT GROW MORE. NONE OF THE MEMBERS OF THE PARISH COUNCIL RECEIVE PAYMENT FOR THEIR WORK BECAUSE IT IS VOLUNTARY. TWO MAJOR DEVELOPMENTS WHICH THE CHAIR MAN WOULD LIKE TO SEE IN THE VILLAGE ARE A LIBRARY AND ANOTHER PLAYING FIELD FOR RECREATION.AT PRESENT BANKS,LIKE THE NEARBY VILLAGES,HAS ONLY A MOBILE LIBRARY VAN WHICH COMES FORTNIGHTLY. THERE IS NOW A HEALTH CENTRE IN BANKS WHICH IS VERY HELPFUL.THE COUNCIL HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR HELPING PEOPLE AND CARING FOR THE COMMUNITY.IF REPAIRS NEED CARRYING OUT THEY NOTIFY THE DISTRICT COUNCIL. THEY ALSO TAKE PART IN DISCUSSIONS ABOUT BUILDING AND PLANNING IN BANKS.
